What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version discrtr GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples. can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(discrtr) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

what: discrtr: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case) — discrtr-package
title: discrtr: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case) — discrtr-package
discrtr: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case) — discrtr-package
McMaster Commuting Dataset (csv file). — mc_commute.csv
text: delimited text file containing information commuting McMaster University. Data collected means travel survey fall 2010. Respondents asked mode travel McMaster University, Hamilton, Canada. also asked modes available . characteristics trips self-reported imputed. dataset also contains relevant attributes respondents. format table long, row representing choice situation.

title: McMaster Commuting Dataset (csv file). — mc_commute.csv
text: comma separated text file : RespondentID Unique identifier respondents choice numeric variable indicating modes transportation: (1) Cycle, (2) Walk, (3) HSR (local transit), (4) Car avcycle Indicator variable availability cycling: (1) Yes, (0) avwalk Indicator variable availability walking: (1) Yes, (0) avhsr Indicator variable availability HSR: (1) Yes, (0) avcar Indicator variable availability car: (1) Yes, (0) timecycle Travel time cycling minutes (mode available coded 100000) timewalk Travel time walking minutes (mode available coded 100000) accesshsr Access time HSR minutes waitingtimehsr Waiting time travelling HSR minutes transfer Number transit transfers timecar Travel time car minutes (mode available coded 100000) parking Indicator variable holding university parking permit: (1) Yes, (0) vehind Indicator variable individual access private car (.e., car shared household members): (1) Yes, (0) owncycle Indicator variable owning bicycle: (1) Yes, (0) gender Indicator variable gender: (1) Female, (0) Male age Age years solo Indicator variable living solo accommodations: (1) Yes, (0) shared Indicator variable living shared accommodations: (1) Yes, (0) family Indicator variable living family home: (1) Yes, (0) child Indicator variable presence dependent minors household: (1) Yes, (0) primary_caregiver Indicator variable primary caregiver dependent minors according 2006 census Canada dwell_den Dwelling density dissemination area place residence $1/km^2$ lum Entropy land use mix st_den Street density dissemination area place residence $km/km^2$ inter_den Intersection density dissemination area place residence $1/km^2$ SF_P_ratio Ratio surface plots built area side_density Sidewalk density dissemination area place residence $km/km^2$ title: McMaster Commuting Dataset (csv file). — mc_commute.csv
code: library(readr)  mc_commute <- read_csv(system.file("extdata", "mc_commute.csv", package = "discrtr")) #> Rows: 1376 Columns: 39 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> dbl (39): RespondentID, choice, avcycle, avwalk, avhsr, avcar, timecycle, ti... #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: McMaster Commuting Dataset (long format). — mc_commute_long
text: dataset containing information commuting McMaster University. Data collected means travel survey fall 2010. Respondents asked mode travel McMaster University, Hamilton, Canada. also asked modes available . characteristics trips self-reported imputed. dataset also contains relevant attributes respondents. format table long, row representing choice situation.

title: McMaster Commuting Dataset (wide format). — mc_commute_wide
text: dataset containing information commuting McMaster University. Data collected means travel survey fall 2010. Respondents asked mode travel McMaster University, Hamilton, Canada. also asked modes available . characteristics trips self-reported imputed. dataset also contains relevant attributes respondents. format table wide, individual decision maker row.
